title: The Whale's Tail Music Lineup
description: A family- and dog-friendly spot with drinks, lawn games, public art, curated local food trucks, and live music, creating a vibrant weekend destination.
location: The Whale's Tail outdoor garden bar in Golden Gate Park (off JFK Promenade just west of the Rose Garden at the 14th Avenue East Meadow)

title: Storytime: For Toddlers
description: Books, songs, movement and more. For toddlers 16 months through age 2 and their caregivers. Space limited. Tickets available on a first come basis at the reference desk starting at 10am.
location: Bernal Heights Branch Library (patio, children's room entrance)

title: Storytime: For Preschoolers
description: Books, songs, fingerplays and more for ages 3-5.

title: Storytime: For Babies
description: Songs, rhymes and books for infants and their caregivers. Space limited. Tickets available on a first come basis at the reference desk starting at 10am.
location: Bernal Heights Branch Library (outside the children's room door)

title: Mission Community Market – Mission District
description: A lively outdoor market with fresh produce, local vendors, and live music. Fun for all ages — bring the whole family for a weekday outing.

title: Flower Piano – SF Botanical Garden
description: Magical outdoor concerts with 12 pianos scattered through the gardens, performances for kids, and surprise sets among the blooms. Free for SF residents; all ages welcome.

title: Telescope Viewing at Chabot Space & Science Center – Oakland
description: Free stargazing on the observatory deck with astronomers. Ages 5+; weather dependent—check before you go.

title: Doodling or Journaling
description: Relax and unwind from the day by doodling or journaling your worries away. Materials provided or bring your own.

title: Bay Sox Girls Baseball Clinic (Ages 7–10)
description: Free clinic for girls of all skill levels to work on baseball fundamentals this offseason. Session for ages 7–10 on Saturday, September 13 from 10 to 11:30 a.m. Equipment provided.

title: Summer Birding at North Lake (Children 5–12)
description: SF Nature Education volunteers lead a birds walk for children ages 5–12 (accompanied by a parent or guardian) on Saturday, September 13 from 10 a.m. to noon.
location: North Lake, Golden Gate Park (meet at parking area off 43rd Avenue and Fulton Street)

title: Mobile Rec at Duboce Park
description: Free BMX biking, skateboarding, and more. Skateboarding equipment provided.
location: Duboce Park, Duboce Avenue and Scott Street

title: Community Playdate – McKinley Square
description: A big neighborhood morning hang with open play, a craft table, and a pop-up from @noomoon.shop. Free to attend, all ages welcome. First 20 guests will take home a Playdate tote!
location: McKinley Square, 20th St & Vermont St, San Francisco, CA

title: 125th Anniversary Celebration of Duboce Park
description: Join the Friends of Duboce Park for its 125th anniversary celebration on Saturday, September 13. The day will feature family-friendly activities including a giant obstacle jump house, dodgeball tournament, scavenger hunt, lawn games, arts and crafts, face painting, live music, food trucks, and more. A special photo display will showcase the park's history, from its role after the 1906 Earthquake to the evolution of the playgrounds and recreation center.
location: Duboce Park (Duboce Avenue and Noe Street)

title: The Whale's Tail Music Lineup (September 13)
description: The Whale's Tail transforms into a vibrant weekend destination with drinks, lawn games, public art, local food trucks and live music. This family- and dog-friendly spot features Donovan Plant, Pete Kronowitt, The Alleylots, and Tyler Ross on Saturday, September 13 from noon to 6 p.m.
location: The Whale's Tail outdoor garden bar, Golden Gate Park (off the JFK Promenade near 14th Avenue East Meadow)

title: Bay Sox Girls Baseball Clinic (Ages 11–14)
description: Free clinic for girls of all skill levels to work on baseball fundamentals this offseason. Session for ages 11–14 on Saturday, September 13 from noon to 1:30 p.m. Equipment provided.

title: Noe Valley Art Festival – Noe Valley Town Square
description: A free community art festival with 22 artists, live music, painting demos, and hands-on kids' activities. All ages welcome; great family outing in the heart of Noe.

title: Mobile Rec at Zion Skate Plaza
description: Enjoy free BMX biking, skateboarding and more at Golden Gate Park’s Mobile Rec. Skateboarding equipment provided. Sunday, September 14 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.
location: Zion Skate Plaza (Waller and Stanyan streets)

title: Oogubi Sensory Play
description: Morning playdate with water play, sensory setups, and creative activities designed for kids to explore while parents connect. Free for adults, kids ages 10mo–12yrs welcome (activities safe for 6mo+). Enjoy 10% off the beer & wine garden plus exclusive food truck discounts.
location: 601 Mission Bay Blvd North, San Francisco, CA 94158

title: The Whale's Tail Music Lineup (September 14)
description: The Whale's Tail transforms into a vibrant weekend destination with drinks, lawn games, public art, local food trucks and live music. This family- and dog-friendly spot features Kevin Coffey, John Tardiff, Joe Andrews, and Tomfoolery on Sunday, September 14 from noon to 6 p.m.
location: The Whale's Tail outdoor garden bar, Golden Gate Park (off the JFK Promenade near 14th Avenue East Meadow)

title: Early Learning: Pre-Soccer Skillbuilding with Super Soccer Stars
description: In these parent/caregiver participation classes Super Soccer Stars coaches and puppet friends, Mimi and Pepe, take toddlers through a world of exciting physical activity. Super Soccer Stars use soccer balls to help children develop soccer skills, as well as improve self-confidence, teamwork, physical literacy, and socialization skills. For ages 2–3. Space limited. Reservations required: on.sfpl.org/gpasoccer

title: Storytime: For Families at SPARK Social SF
description: Books, songs, rhymes and fun for children of all ages at SPARK Social SF, 601 Mission Bay Boulevard North.
location: SPARK Social SF, 601 Mission Bay Boulevard North

title: Early Learning: Pre-Soccer Skillbuilding with Super Soccer Stars
description: In these parent/caregiver participation classes Super Soccer Stars coaches and puppet friends, Mimi and Pepe, take toddlers through a world of exciting physical activity. Super Soccer Stars use soccer balls to help children develop soccer skills, as well as improve self-confidence, teamwork, physical literacy and socialization skills. For ages 3–4. Space limited. Reservations required: on.sfpl.org/gpasoccer

title: Early Learning: Swing Into Stories
description: Children's bookmobile service in the park. Outdoor storytime from 10:30–11:00am. For children ages 5 and younger.

title: Social: Quiet Dog Reading Circle
description: Read to or pet a SF SPCA-trained therapy dogs at the library. Read quietly to yourself or a little one, with a friendly dog in your presence.

title: Dog Reading Circle
description: Practice reading with peers and a certified dog from San Francisco Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (SFSPCA) on a monthly basis.

title: Tilden Tots – Nature Exploration
description: Bring your littlest ones to the park for nature activities, animal encounters, and storytime. Free drop-in program, no registration required.
location: Tilden Nature Area Visitor Center, Berkeley, CA

title: Activity: LEGO and Magna-tiles Free Play
description: Build and create with LEGO bricks and mini-figures, as well as Magna-Tile blocks. For children and their caregivers.

title: Workshop: Mola Paper Cutouts
description: Learn about the tradition of working with vibrant colors, patterns and representational images of the Kuna people of Panama and Columbia while making a paper mola. For children ages 6 and older. Younger children may need adult assistance.

title: Kindness Festival & Concert in the Park
description: Celebrate the International Day of Peace with Mindful Littles' 7th Annual Peace & Kindness Carnival. Enjoy live music by Spill the Wine, themed carnival games, mindful crafts, and community service projects. Free, all ages — bring blankets, chairs, and enjoy the food trucks.
location: Orinda Community Center Park, Orinda, CA

title: Mobile Rec at Joe DiMaggio Playground
description: Mobile Rec kicks off the fall season at Joe DiMaggio Playground (651 Lombard Street) on Saturday, September 20 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Enjoy free BMX biking, skateboarding and more. Skateboarding equipment will be provided.

title: Early Learning: Saturday Morning Playtime
description: Share toddler friendly toys and games with others at this open play activity. For ages 0–3.

title: Access to Adventure at Crissy Field Center
description: Come out for Access to Adventure, a free community event designed for families of children and youth with disabilities, on Saturday, September 20 from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Meet at Crissy Field Center (603 Mason Street) and learn about inclusive recreation and after-school and summer programs available in San Francisco while exploring the Presidio of San Francisco's Tunnel Tops. Connect with other families and staff from Support For Families Of Children With Disabilities and Rec and Park's Therapeutic Recreation and Inclusion Services.

title: Mid-Autumn Harvest Festival
description: The Mid-Autumn Harvest Festival returns to Tenderloin Recreation Center (570 Ellis Street) on Saturday, September 20 from 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. This free annual event is a celebration of Southeast Asian art and culture. It will feature live music, arts and crafts, food samples, papaya salad demonstrations, a lantern parade and a soccer tournament for all ages.

title: Activity: Octoplay
description: Create a structure using large colorful slotted pieces as building blocks. For ages 6 and younger.

title: Autumn Abundance Well-Being Fair
description: Rec and Park's Harvey Milk Center for the Arts (50 Scott Street), in partnership with Mukunda Studio and Tendwell Collective, will host the 12th seasonal Autumn Abundance Well-Being Fair on Saturday, September 20 from noon to 5 p.m. This free, all-ages event features 30 local practitioners—including teachers, coaches, therapists, artists, and Harvey Milk Center instructors—offering classes, healing sessions, conversation circles, art and writing activations, and more.
location: Harvey Milk Center for the Arts (50 Scott Street)

title: King of the Streets – Lowrider Parade & Car Show
description: Celebrate lowrider culture with a massive parade, hopping competition, and a car show at 24th & Mission. Free, all ages — expect crowds, music, and vibrant community energy.
location: Mission Street (between Cesar Chavez & 17th Street) and 24th & Mission, San Francisco, CA

title: Free "Big Hero 6" Screening at Union Square
description: Come out for Cinema on the Square, a series of three free San Francisco-themed movies in Union Square Plaza (333 Post Street). The second screening in this series, presented in partnership with Alamo Drafthouse Cinema, takes place on Saturday, September 20 featuring "Big Hero 6." Pre-show fun, hosted by SFFilm, starts at 5:30 p.m. with hands-on art activities from The Walt Disney Family Museum. Test your trivia skills before the 7:30 p.m. screening for a chance to win prizes from Alamo Drafthouse and the Westin St. Francis.

title: Civic Center Scholastic Chess Tournament
description: Join the Civic Center Community Benefit District and Mechanics' Institute for a youth chess tournament in UN Plaza (Market and Hyde streets) on Sunday, September 21 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. The USCF-rated and non-rated event is open to all players through 12th grade. Test your skills against Grandmaster Sam Shankland in a simultaneous exhibition; sign-ups for the simul will be on site.

title: Free Programming in Union Square: Family Sunday Fundays
description: Calling all kids and their families! Join us for fun and free drop-in S.T.E.A.M. activities led by Maker Studio Kidz and/or local museums. Activities geared towards kids aged 5 – 12. Caretaker supervision is required at all times. https://sfrecpark.org/calendar.aspx?EID=8027
location: Union Square - Post and Stockton San Francisco CA 94108

title: Sunday Streets – Western Addition
description: Experience the neighborhood car-free with live music, family activities, and community connection. Free, all ages — stroll, bike, and play in the open streets.
location: O'Farrell Street between Steiner & Fillmore, San Francisco, CA

title: Mobile Rec at Sunday Streets Western Addition
description: Mobile Rec will be providing archery for Sunday Streets Western Addition on Sunday, September 21 from noon to 4 p.m. Enjoy free BMX biking, skateboarding and more.

title: Activity: Create with Nature
description: Discover your love of nature with this open-ended natural loose parts play event designed to inspire curiosity, creativity, connection to the natural world and to each other. For children and their families.

title: Social: Monday Fun Day Family Dance Party
description: Shake your sillies out to a family-friendly pop playlist with your family and friends. For children ages 5 and younger.

title: Workshop: Super Soccer Stars
description: In these parent/caregiver-participation* sample classes, Super Soccer Stars coaches and puppet friends, Mimi and Pepe, take toddlers through a world of exciting physical activities. For children ages 1–2 and their caregivers. Super Soccer Stars coaches use soccer balls to help children develop soccer skills as well as improve self-confidence, teamwork, physical literacy and socialization skills. Space limited. Reservation required: tinyurl.com/y7kmbchj . If you have already attended a class, please leave space for others to join in a sample class. *Parent/Caregiver and Child Participation class - adults are required to assist their child throughout class.

title: Workshop: Super Soccer Stars
description: In these parent/caregiver-participation* sample classes, Super Soccer Stars coaches and puppet friends, Mimi and Pepe, take toddlers through a world of exciting physical activities. For children ages 2–3 and their caregivers. Super Soccer Stars coaches use soccer balls to help children develop soccer skills as well as improve self-confidence, teamwork, physical literacy and socialization skills. Space limited. Reservation required: tinyurl.com/y7kmbchj . If you have already attended a class, please leave space for others to join in a sample class. *Parent/Caregiver and Child Participation class - adults are required to assist their child throughout class.

title: Social: Infant Parent Support Group
description: Share your experience, ask questions and explore topics such as the emotional adjustment to parenthood, infant feeding, infant movement and development, sleep strategies and anything else that is on your mind. For parents of infants ages 6 weeks–6 months. Facilitated by Marguerite Gilligan, a Child'Space Practitioner and Nurse Lactation Consultant. Gilligan has a special interest in infant movement and development and a passion for supporting families.

title: Library on the Promenade
description: ​​​​​​The San Francisco Public Library invites you to visit the Bookmobile at the JFK Promenade. Every Monday through September 29, you can find the library on wheels at the corner of JFK Promenade and Conservatory Drive, west of the Conservatory of Flowers, from 4 to 7 p.m. https://sfrecpark.org/calendar.aspx?EID=8747
location: JFK Promenade - John F. Kennedy Promenade San Francisco CA 94118

title: Early Learning: Swing Into Stories
description: 200 John F Shelley Dr McLaren Park San Francisco , CA 94134 United States Children's bookmobile service in the park. Outdoor storytime from 10:30–11:00am. For children ages 5 and younger.

title: Free Programming in Union Square: Toddler Tuesday
description: Bring your little ones for interactive and musical activities, led on a rotating basis by Happily Ever Laughter, JAMaROO Kids, Music Together of San Francisco, and the SF Public Library. https://sfrecpark.org/calendar.aspx?EID=7807
location: Union Square - Post and Stockton San Francisco CA 94108

title: Workshop: Once Upon an Opera, The Monkey King with Puppeteer Ramon Abad
description: Puppeteer Ramon Abad will lead a family-friendly demonstration of the styles of puppets used in San Francisco Opera's world premiere production of The Monkey King , by Huang Ruo and Henry Daivid Hwang. Bring your creativity and openness to make several puppets move and come to life, together. For children and their caregivers. Connect: San Francisco Opera - Website

title: Rooftop Jazz – Salesforce Park
description: Free live jazz by local Bay Area musicians, perfect for lunch-break or stroller walk-in outings. Family-friendly vibe; bring a blanket, snacks, or picnic. Outdoor seating + greenery.
location: Salesforce Park (Main Plaza), 425 Mission St, San Francisco, CA

title: Garden Playdate – Melrose Branch
description: Outdoor open-play time in the garden & patio; for ages 0-5. English & Español. Free, just drop in. Great morning garden-stroll + play time.
location: Melrose Branch Library, Melrose Branch Garden & Patio, San Francisco, CA

title: Activity: Playtime For Families in Japanese/日本語
description: Every 2nd and 4th Thursdays. お子さんと日本語でプレイタイムの場をお届けいたします。毎月第２と第４木曜日にて。

title: Free Fall Open Studios – 1890 Bryant
description: Dozens of artist studios open; kid-friendly browsing and demos. Free entry; stroller-friendly building.
location: 1890 Bryant St Studios, 1890 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA

title: Clancy's Pumpkin Patch – Sunset District
description: San Francisco's classic family pumpkin patch returns with pumpkins, gourds, corn stalks, a hay maze, and festive photo ops. Free admission; pumpkins for purchase.
location: Clancy's Pumpkin Patch, 2101 Sloat Blvd, San Francisco, CA

title: Chinatown Autumn Moon Festival – Chinatown
description: Dragon dance parade, live music, food stalls, kids crafts. Free, family-friendly street fair.
location: Chinatown (Grant Ave & Bush St), San Francisco, CA

title: Early Learning: Big San Francisco Play Date
description: Play, learn and explore with OctoPlay, a sticky table, Twig Toys and more. For ages 5 and younger and their caregivers. Big San Francisco Play Date provides families with young children the opportunity to engage in accessible activities that promote growth and exploration in a safe and welcoming environment. Geared for children ages 0–5, we welcome caregivers and older siblings to play along with them. Big Play Date encourages side-by-side play, choice, turn-taking and making new friends for children while providing their grown-ups an opportunity to learn about the importance of play.

title: City Kids Family Fair – Children's Council SF
description: Free community fair with games, activities, free books, diapers, fresh produce, and early education resources. Doors open 9:45am. Free admission; tickets here.
location: Children's Council of San Francisco, 445 Church St, San Francisco, CA 94114

title: Early Learning: Saturday Morning Playtime
description: Share toddler friendly toys and games with others at this open play activity. For ages 0–3.

title: Performance: Very First Concerts
description: Very First Concerts are a classical series designed with the youngest listeners in mind. Each interactive, 30 minute concert features a central theme, short selections, and fun hands-on musical activities geared toward families with young children. These are two back-to-back shows at 11a and 11:45a. Space limited. For children and their caregivers.

title: Performance: Very First Concerts
description: Very First Concerts are a classical series designed with the youngest listeners in mind. Each interactive, 30 minute concert features a central theme, short selections and fun hands-on musical activities geared toward families with young children. These are two back-to-back shows at 11a and 11:45a. Space limited. For children and their caregivers.

title: All the Way Live Hip Hop Dance Festival
description: Join All the Way Live Foundation at Fulton Plaza (Fulton Street between Larkin and Hyde streets) for its Hip Hop Dance Festival on Saturday, September 27 from noon to 6 p.m. This free event will feature dance competitions with prize money, as well as local artists, kids' activities, food trucks, vendor market, live DJs and more!
location: Fulton Plaza (Fulton Street between Larkin and Hyde streets)

title: Early Learning: Arabic Story Hour
description: Special guest Radwa presents stories and songs in Arabic and English, followed by a fun activity. For children and their caregivers.

title: Social: Family Dance Party
description: Dance to funky family-friendly jams and be silly with your little one. For children and their caregivers.

title: KPSF Open Family Day
description: Family day at the Kunal Patel San Francisco Open finals on September 28 kicks off at 10 a.m. There will be on-court tennis games for ages 4+, and off-court fun including a balloon artist, glitter tattoos, caricatures, face-painting, a free gift and more.
location: Goldman Tennis Center (50 Bowling Green Drive)

title: Free Programming in Union Square: Family Sunday Fundays
description: Calling all kids and their families! Join us for fun and free drop-in S.T.E.A.M. activities led by Maker Studio Kidz and/or local museums. Activities geared towards kids aged 5 – 12. Caretaker supervision is required at all times. https://sfrecpark.org/calendar.aspx?EID=8028
location: Union Square - Post and Stockton San Francisco CA 94108

title: Early Learning: Family Playtime
description: For children ages 5 and younger and their caregivers.

title: Social: Baby Playtime
description: Meet other neighborhood families with babies at this special playtime. We will have a book giveaway and refreshments as well! For babies ages 0–18 months and their caregivers.

title: Kids Day in the Park
description: A festival of creativity & fun with live music, face painting, bouncy houses, exhibits, and food trucks! Tickets required.
location: Plaza de César Chávez, San Jose, CA

title: Library on the Promenade
description: ​​​​​​The San Francisco Public Library invites you to visit the Bookmobile at the JFK Promenade. Every Monday through September 29, you can find the library on wheels at the corner of JFK Promenade and Conservatory Drive, west of the Conservatory of Flowers, from 4 to 7 p.m. https://sfrecpark.org/calendar.aspx?EID=8748
location: JFK Promenade - John F. Kennedy Promenade San Francisco CA 94118

title: Free Programming in Union Square: Toddler Tuesday
description: Bring your little ones for interactive and musical activities, led on a rotating basis by Happily Ever Laughter, JAMaROO Kids, Music Together of San Francisco, and the SF Public Library. https://sfrecpark.org/calendar.aspx?EID=7808
location: Union Square - Post and Stockton San Francisco CA 94108

title: Tenderloin Children's Playground Groundbreaking
description: Join Rec and Park for a groundbreaking event at the Tenderloin Children's Playground (570 Ellis Street) on Wednesday, October 1 at 9:30 a.m. The celebration marks the beginning of a new era for this popular neighborhood play space, which will transform into a nature-based, multi-functional space that balances active play, nature exploration, and quiet relaxation. The project is a partnership with KaBOOM!, the Mimi and Peter Haas Fund, Crankstart, CalFire, Wu Yee Children's Services, SF Children & Nature, and the Low Income Investment Fund.

title: Activity: Mini-Makers
description: 155 Winston Drive San Francisco , CA 94132 United States Hands-on maker fun encouraging, curiosity, creativity and the use of fine and gross motor skills. From art projects, to playdough, to learning what floats, there's a different project every month. For children ages 3 and younger.

title: Early Learning: Saturday Morning Playtime
description: Share toddler friendly toys and games with others. For ages 0–3.

title: Performance: Megan Schoenbohm
description: Move your feet to beloved Bay Area children’s musician and Bay Beats artist, Megan Schoenbohm. Megan Schoenbohm – Facebook Megan Schoenbohm – Instagram Megan Schoenbohm – YouTube Megan Schoenbohm – Website Learn more about Tricycle Music Fest at SFPL TMF – Website Learn more about Bay Beats at SFPL Bay Beats – Website

title: Activity: Make Kaleidoscopes
description: Learn how to make a simple kaleidoscope and see the world in a dazzling new way. For children and their caregivers.

title: Social: Group Bike Ride
description: Learn and practice the basics of urban biking with children through a fun and easy ride in the Marina. Skilled instructors will give a 30-minute introduction to basic group ride etiquette and street riding safety, followed by a roughly hour-long group ride leaving from and returning to the Marina Branch Library. A limited number of bicycles will be available to borrow, but please bring your own if you have one. E-bikes are welcome. Children who know how to ride or can be carried on a caregiver's bike are encouraged to participate. Please note: this is not a learn-to-ride activity. Connect: SF Bicycle Coalition - Instragram | San Francisco Safe Routes to School - Website

title: Performance: Mariela's Music Time
description: See an exciting, energetic, and interactive bilingual performance in Spanish and English filled with rhythms and multicultural sounds, along with with the rich traditions of the Bay Area. For children 5 and younger and their families.
